Visit Carsons Tavern in Stuart for all of your favorite American dishes. The drink list at this restaurant has everything you need to complete your meal (and your night out). From cheap drinks to good eats, Carsons Tavern's happy hour is a steal. Summer meals will taste even better when you enjoy them on Carsons Tavern's gorgeous patio. At Carsons Tavern, you might get dinner and a show as live music is often featured as well as a DJ. Carsons Tavern patrons enjoy a taste of live music with their food as well. Live DJs often entertain the evening crowd while dining. The restaurant can get tied up on the weekends, so allow yourself time to wait for a table. If time is of the essence, this restaurant's take-out option may be a better fit. Driving to the restaurant is easy as pie, and parking surrounds the area. Store your bike at one of the many racks outside of Carsons Tavern. If you go out for a nice meal, it doesn't need to cost $100, come treat yourself at Carsons Tavern. Don't put it off any longer, and give Carsons Tavern a try. Trending in Groupon Groupon is your place for savings and discovery while exploring fun activities in your city and around the country. Malta eatery revived as Carson’s Woodside Tavern – Saratogian Skip to content All Sections Subscribe Now 54°F Wednesday, September 10th 2025 E-Edition Home Page News Local News Election Crime and Public Safety Traffic Health Gas Buddy Best Reviews World News Sports Sports High School Sports College Sports Things to Do Things to Do Entertainment TV Listings Comics Puzzles Special Sections Events Obituaries Obituaries Submit an Obituary Opinion Marketplace Jobs Classifieds Public Notices Services Contact Us Advertise With Us Submit a Letter to the Editor Promotions Branded Content Paid Content by Brandpoint Subscribe Log in Logout Sign up for email newsletters Sign Up Malta eatery revived as Carson’s Woodside Tavern Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Subscribe Log in Account Settings Contact Us Log Out Spoof a user Sign up for email newsletters Sign Up Subscribe Log in Search 54°F Wednesday, September 10th 2025 E-Edition News Sports Things to Do Obituaries Opinion Classifieds News Malta eatery revived as Carson’s Woodside Tavern Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Shown is the exterior of Carson's Woodside Tavern at 57 Route 9P in Malta. Malta eatery revived as Carson's Woodside Tavern J.S.CARRAS PHOTOS – JCARRAS@DIGITALFIRSTMEDIA.COM Shown from left are Carson's Woodside Tavern Executive Chef Mike Cunningham, owner Susie Carson, Stephanie Carson and owner Bill Carson. Show Caption 1 of 3 Shown is the exterior of Carson's Woodside Tavern at 57 Route 9P in Malta. Expand By Lauren Halligan | lhalligan@troyrecord.com | The Saratogian UPDATED: July 22, 2021 at 12:55 PM EDT MALTA>> A longstanding lakeside restaurant has changed hands and new traditions are now being made at Carson’s Woodside Tavern. Located at 57 Route 9P in Malta, the space was formerly known as Cliff’s Country Inn. The longtime business, once owned by Cliff and Kathy Barlow, closed its doors in January after 37 years of continuous operation. The establishment was purchased by Carson Greiner, LLC earlier this year and the brand new Carson’s Woodside Tavern opened last month. The new bar and restaurant has a totally revamped interior, a new chef and a fresh menu (with some old favorites from Cliff’s). Local resident Bill Carson, the former owner and operator of Ravenswood Restaurant in Clifton Park for nearly 30 years, is one of four partners in the new family-owned and run enterprise. Carson serves as general manager and is delighted to be working with his wife, Susie, daughter Stephanie, who is now bar manager, and his future son-in-law executive chef Mike Cunningham, who formerly served as kitchen manager at Ravenswood. Carson’s son Ryan will assist in the kitchen in the center line position as well. Co-owners Gail and April Greiner-Hammond from Syracuse are also part of the family and key players on the Carson’s Woodside Tavern team. Gail will oversee all current and future renovation work and April will serve as website and social media manager. “It’s definitely a family effort,” Susie Carson said. Together, the family is set on making Carson’s Woodside Tavern a success. Bill Carson was looking for another business opportunity and when Cliff Barlow personally called and asked him about purchasing the space, Carson knew he had found it. Sitting on a four-acre plot of land, Carson’s Woodside Tavern has a large indoor dining area, as well as patio seating with an incredible, newly-cleared view of Saratoga Lake. “It’s pretty out there,” Susie Carson said, “and we want to take advantage of it.” “We see not only the restaurant, but we see the property as an asset,” Bill Carson agreed. In addition to offering quality food and service, “We have a vision for the property as well,” he said. The family plans to expand the restaurant’s deck to incorporate an outdoor bar, fire pits and summer entertainment, all with a lakeview. The Carson’s Woodside Tavern menu is a combination of bestselling items from Ravenswood, Cliff’s Country Inn and some new ideas from chef Cunningham, who most recently worked as executive sous chef at Beekman Arms in Rhinebeck. The most popular dishes so far are fish and chips, WTF! (Woodside Tavern Favorite) wings, and the slow-roasted prime rib, which was a Cliff’s staple. The Woodside sandwich, made with prime rib, bacon, aged cheddar cheese and horseradish, is another favorite. Different, creative weekly specials are on the menu every Friday and Saturday, too. During the week guests can enjoy happy hour from to 6 p.m., with and extended happy hour on Mondays that is offered until closing time. The seasonal drink menu, which features a summer sangria, was recently unveiled and is gaining popularity as temperatures rise. On Friday and Saturday nights, Carson’s Woodside Tavern has live entertainment from 8 to 11 p.m. featuring a variety of local musicians. The Carsons’ goal in opening the tavern is to be a longstanding, community-focused local hotspot. “We’re looking to be here for many many years to come,” Bill Carson said. “We’re hospitality-oriented. We want to know our customers names. It’s very important to us.” Carson’s Woodside Tavern is open seven days a week for lunch and dinner. Hours are 11 a.m. to midnight Monday through Saturday and noon to 11 p.m. on Sundays. The restaurant will hold its grand opening celebration on the evening of Saturday, June 13, with live music by Franklin Micare. Funds raised at the event will benefit the Make-A-Wish Foundation. For more information and event details visit www.carsonswoodside.com or call the restaurant at 584-9791. Lauren Halligan may be reached at 290-1443. Contact • Carson's Tavern • Scottdale PA Restaurant Skip to content ORDER ONLINE × Home Menu Main Menu Specials Buffet Italian Buffet Seafood Buffet Sunday Brunch Thanksgiving Buffet Brunch with Santa Holiday To Go New Years Buffet Catering Menu Banquets Events About Rewards Contact ORDER ONLINE Home Menu Main Menu Specials Buffet Italian Buffet Seafood Buffet Sunday Brunch Thanksgiving Buffet Santa Brunch Holiday To Go New Years Buffet Catering Specials Events About Rewards Contact CONTACT LOCATION 10 South Broadway Scottdale, PA 15683 EMAIL carsons@carsonscatering.com PHONE 724-887-7404 Hours Takeout Window - Open Thursday to Sunday Delivery by DoorDash Monday - Wednesday Closed Thursday Kitchen 3pm-9pm Tavern 3pm-9pm Friday Kitchen 11am-10pm Tavern 11am-10pm Saturday Kitchen 11am-10pm Tavern 11am-10pm Sunday Brunch 10:30am-2pm Regular Menu 11am - 7pm Tavern 11am - 7pm Reservations For reservation set up or additional information about our award winning food and services, Contact Carson’s by calling (724) 887-7404, click the button below, or visit us in person on South Broadway during operating hours. You can also make online reservations at any time! Restaurant reservations are suggested, but not required. Whether you have a casual occasion coming up, a formal wedding to plan, or if you simply need a side dish and dessert for a picnic, our team at Carson’s will meet your needs with complete satisfaction. Make your next occasion memorable with a beautiful setting, superior service, good smelling and delicious catering from Carson’s! A wall mounted picture frame in a bespoke design . Our meet the staff photo boards can be produced to any size and shape required. They are available in a wide range of materials/finishes including acrylic, brushed aluminium and brushed black aluminium Our Meet the Staff Photo Boards are designed to be completely unique for your business, organisation or school. Also available are Meet and Greet Photo Board with Optional IN / OUT sliders to show which members of staff are available. An optional extra, easily removed, clear acrylic security cover covers the whole board to stop anyone tampering with the photos. This can be quickly and easily removed to enable easy changing of photos. Photo Pockets/Photographs The clear photo pockets, which are available in any size you require, allow the photos to be easily changed without removing the frame from the wall. We also produce the staff photos to be inserted with the staff members name and job title printed on. If any staff change, simply let us know the changes and we will produce a new photo for you to insert. Delivery/Installation Our Meet and Greet Photo Boards are supplied with all fixtures and fittings including aluminium stand off mounts to give a 3D effect. A drilling template is also supplied to make fitting very easy.
